channel.title: Settings on JNyman.com
channel.description: Recent content in Settings on JNyman.com

item.title: Creating a Settings Class in VBA
item.description: In .NET they have a nice settings class you can create using ApplicationSettingsBase base class. In VBA it takes a bit more work to get it working, but can be fairly elegant if done correctly. Some criteria that is needed for a settings class in vba are: Well formed Fast lookup Default setting Single input/output procedures. To make it well formed I used an enumeration variable type to create each setting.
